en: O God thou hast cast us off, thou hast broken us down; Thou hast been angry; oh restore us again.
hmr: Aw Pathien, nangin i mi thlauthlâk a, i mi suksiet a, I lo lunginsen tah am; aw, mi tungding nâwk rawh.

en: Thou hast made the land to tremble; thou hast rent it: Heal the breaches thereof; for it shaketh.
hmr: Hi ram hi i sukthin a, i sukkak tah a, A kakhai chu siemṭha nâwk la, ân hnîng ân hnîng sih a.

en: Thou hast showed thy people hard things: Thou hast made us to drink the wine of staggering.
hmr: I mihai hi thil inkhawtakhai în tuoktir a, Pêmna uoin chu i mîn dâwn tir tah a.

en: Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, That it may be displayed because of the truth. [Selah
hmr: Nangma ṭituhai che kuoma chun puonzâr i pêk tah a, Thutak leia zar a ni theina dingin.

en: That thy beloved may be delivered, Save with thy right hand, and answer us.
hmr: I dittakhai hi sanhima an um theina dingin, I kut changtiengin sandam la, mi hung dawn rawh.

en: God hath spoken in his holiness: I will exult; I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
hmr: Pathienin ân thiengnaa chun hieng ang hin a hril a, “Hlimtakin Sekem chu khawi dar ka ta, Sukkoth ruom chu sem dar bawk ka tih.

en: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the defence of my head; Judah is my sceptre.
hmr: Gilead chu ka ta a na, Manasse khawm ka ta a nih; Ephraim khawm chu ka lu humhimna a na, Juda chu ka lalhmawl a nih.

en: Moab is my washpot; Upon Edom will I cast my shoe: Philistia, shout thou because of me.
hmr: Moab chu kân sâwpna bêl a na; Edoma chun ka kekawk pei ka tih; Philistia khawm chu hnein khêk khum ka tih,” tiin.

en: Who will bring me into the strong city? Who hath led me unto Edom?
hmr: Khawpui dettaka chun tuin am mi ṭhuoi lût a ta? Edom rama chun tuin am mi ṭhuoi a ta?

en: Hast not thou, O God, cast us off? And thou goest not forth, O God, with our hosts.
hmr: Aw Pathien, nangma ngeiin i mi thlauthlâk a ni naw am a nih? Aw Pathien, kan sipaihai kuoma hlak i suok ve ta si nawh a.

en: Give us help against the adversary; For vain is the help of man.
hmr: A mi dotuhai thaw dingin mi ṭhangpui la; Mihriem ṭhangpuina chu teplo mei mei a ni sih a.

en: Through God we shall do valiantly; For he it is that will tread down our adversaries.
hmr: Pathien zârah huoitakin thawng ei ta, Ama chu a mi dotuhai sirdetu ding a ni sih a.
